) Command Code DOALL incorporates the most frequently used features Command Codes ACTON, LETER, STAUP, ASGNI/B, TELEA, and Normally, two or more of these commands are input in sequence for a volume of adjustments/correspondence cases. Combining up to six actions into one command greatly facilitates working these cases. (

) In addition, Command Code DOALL allows many data items to be input by entering an asterisk or a one character code in place of the data element. The program will substitute a predetermined value for that data element before processing the request. (
) Use Command Code DOALL when it is necessary to initiate one or more the following actions for an account: a) Establish, update, or close a control base for a tax module. See Section
b) Write an acknowledgment or other computer generated letter to the taxpayer. See Section

) It is helpful to remember that while DOALL does incorporate features of numerous other command codes, it is not designed to replace those codes. If difficulty is encountered trying to accomplish an action for an using DOALL, use ACTON, LETER, STAUP, ASGNI/B, TELEA, or MFTRA appropriate. Speciﬁc information regarding the functions performed by Command Code DOALL can be found in Sections

Account identiﬁcation data is stored in terminal memory and need not be re- entered as part of the DOALL request. All prerequisites store the TIN and ﬁle source. In addition, CC TXMOD stores the MFT, Plan Number (EPMF only), and the Tax Period. (

) Generally, the research sequence prior to the input of DOALL will be the CC ENMOD and/or CC SUMRY , followed by CC TXMOD. Any other necessary research should also be performed prior to the input of CC CC TXMOD input is not necessary, however, if ENMOD or SUMRY shows the account is not on the TIF or that a “HISTORY ONLY” account is present. Also CC TXMOD input is not necessary if SUMRY shows that the tax to be controlled etc. is not on the ﬁle.

containing erroneous account data, and then proceed directly to a DOALL request. The MFT, tax period, correct name control for the taxpayer, and plan number (EPMF only) must be entered on screen line
of the DOALL Request, when not returned by the previous TXMOD. When ENMOD or SUMRY request yields the message “ NO DATA AVAILABLE”, DOALL will return the error message: SYSTEM-I/O- ERROR—
—NOTIFY DBA* to signify that the account is not found on the TIF. An account must be present on the TIF for DOALL to process.

If SUMRY shows that the requested tax module is present on the TIF, TXMOD must be entered before controlling the module with DOALL or the error message “INITIATE TXMOD” will result. This is to direct the Customer Service Representa- tive’s attention to possible control or other pertinent information in the module.

If a memo account or module is present on the ﬁle (indicating that the account has been resequenced to another TIN or that an incomplete merge has taken place), DOALL may be used only to update or close an existing control base, initiate corre- spondence, or generate a request for a Master File Transcript.

When a SUMRY request is made and there is only one tax module present for an account, the SUMRY request returns a TXMOD display of that module. If this is not the desired tax module, input TXMOD for the MFT, plan number and the tax period desired. This will result in a SUMRY display. Now DOALL, re-entering the MFT, plan number and tax period of the module to be controlled, along with the taxpayer’s name control.

When a SUMRY request is made and there is only one tax module present for an account, the SUMRY request returns a TXMOD display of that module. If this is not the desired tax module, input TXMOD for the MFT, plan number and the tax period desired. This will result in a SUMRY display. Now DOALL, re
entering the MFT, plan number and tax period of the module to be controlled, along with the taxpayer’s name control.

) All DOALL control base entries are recorded by control sequence number in chronological order in the Control History Section of the tax module. A record is available for display immediately following the DOALL input and be inspected using CC TXMOD. (

(this would be necessary only for an account that has been merged in error). e) See IRM

) “MFTRA” requests generated using DOALL are sent via communications link DOALL ECC-MTB, searches of ﬁles are made for the requested data, and requests are ﬁlled in exactly the same manner and subject to the same time as those generated using MFTRA. (
) Multiple “MFTRA” requests can be requested using Command Code DOALL on screen lines
Up to
separate “MFTRA” requests may be entered one screen. See Exhibit
for description and validity of transcript input ﬁelds. (
) If the “MFTRA” request is wanted only for the Alternate TIN, then the Only Indicator must be “A”. (

) As with CC MFTRA, DOALL requires the input of a request type code to indicate the type of search to be performed. This ﬁeld is required for via CC DOALL. A value or values must also be entered in the MF Transcript Variable Field for certain request types e.g. transaction code with request “T”). If more than one data item must be entered in the variable ﬁeld (e.g., MFT and TAX-PRD), ﬁelds must be separated from each other by commas. a. Enter request type code “A” to request a TRANSACTION AMOUNT search which will return the entity module (except posted entity tions) and all non-low-level tax modules which have a transaction with money (debit/credit) amount matching the transaction amount input in variable ﬁeld. b. Enter request type code “B” to request OPEN BALANCE search which will return the entity module (except posted entity transactions) and all non-low-level tax modules with a balance other than zero. c. Enter request type code “C” to request COMPLETE transcript which includes the complete entity module with posted transactions and all low-level tax modules. For EPMF requests, all plan modules are d. Enter request type code “D” to request TRANSACTION DATE search which will return the entity module (except posted entity transactions), and all non-low-level tax modules with a posted transaction carrying same transaction date as the date input in the variable ﬁeld. e. Enter request type code “E” to request ENTITY transcript which returns the complete entity module with posted transactions. f. Enter request type code “G” to request Debtor Master ﬁle (DMF) tran- scripts (IMF valid only). g. Enter request type code “K” to request hardcopy Literal Transcripts of BMF Tax Modules for one calendar year which ends in “YYYY”.

h. Enter request type code “L” to request Lower Level Modules. (hardcopy transcripts only). (BMF and IMF) The Lower Level Files contain dormant modules which are not yet old enough to go to Retention. i. Enter request type code “M” to request MFT search which will return the entity module (except posted entity transactions), and all non-low-level modules for the MFT speciﬁed in the variable ﬁeld. j. Enter request type code “P” to request the Name of Sponsor, Sponsor’s Address, Plan Numbers, and Plan Names from the EPMF. k. Enter request type code “S” to request SPECIFIC TAX MODULE when the module desired is not the case module. (Use request type code “*”, if the case module is desired.) MFT, Tax Period and EPMF Plan Number are input in the variable ﬁeld. This type of request will return the entity module (except entity posted transactions), and the requested tax module from whatever level it is on. Retention Register information will be provided only if the module is not on the Master File and (for BMF) the module is old enough to be on retention. (Entering “MFT, EPMF Plan Number” will result in the return of all tax modules for the input plan number). l. Enter request type code “T” to request TRANSACTION CODE search which will return the entity module (except posted transactions), and all non-low-level modules containing the transaction code entered in the variable ﬁeld. m. Enter request type code “U” to request a NUMIDENT SSA transcript of Social Security Administration data. NUMIDENT data is a history of changes made to one Social Security account. Requests are allowed for IMF valid segment accounts only. Turnaround is a minimum of two days. n. Enter request type code “X” to request BMF or IMF Literal Transcripts (hardcopy transcripts only). Enter a
digit tax period (YYYY format) to a BMF Literal Transcript of all quarters for that year (e.g.
). (MFTs
, or

only). Spouse requests are not allowed. o. Enter request type code “Y” to request a one year complete transcript (BMF only). Tax Period can be either a YYYY MM or YYYY format. p. Enter request type code “Z” to request a speciﬁc Tax Module from the Annual Temporary Retention Register Backup File. It requires the entry of the full tax period. (IMF and BMF only). “Z” is a temporary request type code and may be discontinued by Master File processing once all Service Centers receive their microﬁlm cartridges. q. Enter request type code “*” to request SPECIFIC TAX MODULE when the module required is the case module. The MFT, Tax Period and EPMF Plan Number do not need to be input in the variable ﬁeld (they will be picked up from the stored data or from screen line

). r. Enter request type code “+” to request DEBIT BALANCE search which return the entity module (except entity posted transactions), and all non- low-level tax modules with a debit module balance. s. Enter request type code “−” to request CREDIT BALANCE search which will return the entity module (except entity posted transactions), and all non-low-level tax modules with a credit module balance. t. Enter request type code “#” to request a DLN search which will return the entity module (except entity posted transactions), and any Tax Module under that TIN which contains that DLN. If no module has that DLN, only the entity module is returned (IMF and BMF only). A hardcopy transcript will be produced.

An attempt will be made to locate the Primary SSN and if found, output is returned under the Primary SSN only (b) Enter “B” when it is not known whether the case SSN is Primary or Secondary; if found at ECC-MTB to be Secondary, output will be returned under that SSN; if case SSN is both a Primary and Secondary SSN, output will be under both numbers (c) Enter “I” when requesting a transcript from both the valid segment and a transcript from the invalid segment of the IMF to be returned on the same TIN. “SI” and “Bl” combinations may also be entered for IMF only.
